name: African Shoebill
description: Standing up to 140 cm tall, the shoebill is unmistakable. Its plumage is ash-gray with darker spotting. Distinctive is its massive beak with a sharp, hooked upper mandible tip. Its tall legs are dark gray, without webbed feet.
proportions: Body length 90–93 cm; tail length 26.5–30.5 cm; wingspan up to 320 cm; weight 5–8 kg
attractions: A solitary bird, it is only seen with its mate during nesting season. Together, they build a ground nest, first clearing a 3-meter diameter area, though the nest itself spans about 1 meter. The parents take turns warming or cooling the eggs. On hot days, they bring water in their beaks to sprinkle the eggs or layer them with damp grass.
breeding: Birds kept at Prague Zoo arrived from Africa in late 2004, and two years later, a pair moved to the Bird Wetlands exhibit in the lower zoo area.
